definition: to slip away/to escape in stealth/to skate
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: They always seem to slip away right when you need them most.
sentences.chinese: 他们似乎经常就在你最需要的时候溜走了。

sentences.english: We let the game slip away, a game that we were in a good position to win.
sentences.chinese: 我们浪费了大好局面，让胜利从眼前溜走。

sentences.english: They were runing from the police like all get-out .
sentences.chinese: 孩子们一看见警察就赶快溜走了。

sentences.english: Even if Chu sword the finishing don't think Zhang behind the autumn, tin this opportunity slipped away for the pearly white.
sentences.chinese: 即使楚剑功不秋后算账，可这机会就白白溜走了。

sentences.english: But Smith rushes too quickly through the words and the moment is gone.
sentences.chinese: 但史密斯念得太快了，时间就这样溜走了。

sentences.english: And for the most part, the Taliban continue to slip away.
sentences.chinese: 而在大多数情况下，塔利班还会继续溜走。

sentences.english: At this moment the young man returned; Danglars withdrew.
sentences.chinese: 这时，那青年人回来了，腾格拉尔便乘机溜走了。

sentences.english: You must be present. Then you'll slip off.
sentences.chinese: 你必须出席，然后你再溜走。

sentences.english: Charlie Bairstow vanished through the back door.
sentences.chinese: 贝斯托便从后门溜走了。

sentences.english: For years she regretted letting the offer slip between her fingers.
sentences.chinese: 多年来，她一直后悔让这次机会从指间溜走。

sentences.english: The lodger has decamped with paying nothing at all.
sentences.chinese: 房客根本没付房租就溜走了。

sentences.english: When the owner of the hotel came to collect the money she found that her guests had done a moonlight.
sentences.chinese: 当旅馆女老板来收账时，发觉旅客已乘黑夜溜走了。

sentences.english: You wake up and time has slipped away.
sentences.chinese: 你醒来时间已经悄然无声地溜走。

sentences.english: Test the seal of your refrigerator to ensure cold air isn’t escaping through the doors.
sentences.chinese: 检查冰箱的密封性，确保冷气不会从冰箱门里溜走。

sentences.english: Aster was calculating on three days of depredation and one day to escape.
sentences.chinese: 埃斯特打算剽掠三天，再用一天时间溜走。

sentences.english: He leaves his friends behind and skips away alone when the shark comes to assault them.
sentences.chinese: 他在沙鱼来袭时抛弃了同伴，读自溜走了。

definition: to run away/to take to one's heels
to pass in an instant/over in the twinkling of an eye
(of time) to pass quickly/to be fleeting
to avail oneself of/to take advantage of
